member.name: T:Library.Core.Processing.InputHandler
member.summary: Represents the functionality of handling one or more messages input until realizing a certain operation successfully, or until the user indicates to stop trying. We created this class because of DIP, that way the other classes depend of abractions. Also we applied the Expert pattern, this specific class is the one in charge of handling messages input.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.InputHandler.ProcessInput(System.String)
member.summary: Handles a received input message, returning a success signal, a response string (indicating it's not done yet), or an interrupt signal.
member.returns:
Result.Err(response), being response a response string,
Result.Ok(true) for a success signal, or
Result.Ok(false) for an interrupt signal.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.InputHandler.GetDefaultResponse
member.summary: Returns the first message the object uses to indicate what kind of input it wants.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.InputHandler.Reset
member.summary: Resets the processor, so it can be used again.

member.name: T:Library.Core.Processing.InputProcessor`1
member.summary: Represents the functionality of receiving one or more input messages, and generating an object with that input. We created this class because of DIP, it depends of an abstract class.
member.typeparam: The type of the resulting object.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.InputProcessor`1.getResult
member.summary: Generates the resulting object with the obtained input.

remarks.para:
This function should be called only after a call to returns:
Result<bool, string>.Ok(true)
which is a signal that the object's ready to produce the result. Doing so under other circumstances may result in undefined behaviour.

member.returns:
Result.Ok(result), being result the resulting object, or
Result.Err(error), being error an error string.

member.name: M:Library.Core.Processing.InputProcessor`1.GenerateFromInput(System.String)
member.summary: Receives an input message, returning the resulting object if it's ready.
member.returns:
Option.Some(Result.Ok(result)), being result the resulting object,
Option.Some(Result.Err(response)), being response a response string, or
Option.None for an interrupt signal.
